definitions.definition: a mixture of raw vegetables such as lettuce, tomato and cucumber, usually served with other food as part of a meal
definitions.labels: (British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(especially North American English)(British English)(British English)

examples.text: All main courses come with salad or vegetables.
Is cold meat and salad OK for lunch?
a **side salad** *(= a small bowl of salad served with the main course of a meal)*
a **salad bowl** *(= a large bowl for serving salad in)*
Toss the salad with the dressing.
She tossed and dressed the salad.
The sandwiches came with a rather limp salad garnish.

definitions.definition: meat, fish, cheese, etc. served with salad
raw or cooked vegetables, etc. that are cut into small pieces, often mixed with mayonnaise and served cold with other food
any green vegetable, especially lettuce, that is eaten raw in a salad

examples.text: baby octopus served with salad greens
Sow salads like lettuce, rocket and spring onions.

definitions.definition: the time when you are young and do not have much experience of life

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French salade, from Provençal salada, based on Latin sal ‘salt’.
